class PhysicsManager

Detailed Description

This class is used to define area's in the world that have unique effects.

Common uses for this class are for gravity fields, and explosions. But can be made to do more.
Note: This is a base class intended to be derived from. This class cannot be created itself. To make an AreaEffect class that does what you want it to, simple inherit from this class with an AE class of your own, and define the ApplyEffect() function to do what you want your effect to do.

Member Function Documentation

virtual void phys::AreaEffect::ApplyEffect (  )  [pure virtual]

Defines and applies the effect of the field.

When inheriting this class, this function is what defines the effect the field has.
This function will be called on by the physics manager and shouldn't be called manually.

Implemented in phys::TestAE, and phys::GravityField.

void phys::AreaEffect::CreateBoxShape ( const Vector3  HalfExtents,
const ColourValue  Colour = ColourValue(0,0,0,0) 
)

Creates a Box shape for the field.

When making the vector to be passed in, remember to pass in only half values of what you want the actual size to be.

Parameters:
HalfExtents The vector representing the size of the shape.

Definition at line 160 of file areaeffect.cpp.

void phys::AreaEffect::CreateCylinderShape ( const Vector3  HalfExtents  ) 

Creates a Cylinder shape for the field.

This function assumes the cylinder will be upright, meaning "up" will be on the positive Y axis.
When making the vector to be passed in, remember the layout should be as such: (radius, height*0.5, radius), with the second radius perpendicular to the first.

Parameters:
HalfExtents The vector representing the size of the shape.

Vector3 phys::AreaEffect::GetLocation (  ) 

Gets the origin for the area effect.

This function is particularly useful when making fields such as gravity wells, that have continuous effects centering on one location.

Returns:
Returns the vector3 representing the location of the area effect.

Definition at line 246 of file areaeffect.cpp.

void phys::AreaEffect::SetLocation ( const Vector3  Location  ) 

Sets the origin for the area effect.

In most cases you won't want to call this, with the exception of when you want a field to follow/track an actor.

Parameters:
Location The updated location of the origin for the field.

Definition at line 257 of file areaeffect.cpp.

void phys::AreaEffect::UpdateActorList (  )  [virtual]

Updates the actors listed as within the field.

This function is automatically called once every simulation step. This shouldn't be called manually unless your usage of this class requires more then one update per step.
